div2.head: [The return of Michail Yaghchi to Basreh after a leave of 4 months]
[Arabic: The death of Abdulrezak the head of the municipality, the son of Sheikh Kader]
[Arabic: The death of Perry the Agent of the Ottoman Bank]
div2.p:
Diary No. 40
I saw Michail Yaghchi
returning to Basreh to the
quarantine after his 4 months
leave, also the Mudir of the
Custom House of Basreh who
come up with us last trip
& Mr. Lander of the Ottoman
Bank passenger~

At 7 am. landed the mails at
the Residency & went to the
Custom House; the S.S. Mossul
is alongside discharging,
we heard of the of the death here
yesterday morning of the
Reis el Beledyeh Abdulrezak
Son of Sheikh Kader, whose
son Rustum Effendi came
up with us from Amara
I went home saw Eliza
Alexander & Tookyeh, all
well, I heard also here
of the death of Mr. Perry
the Agent of the Ottoman
bank at Basreh on Friday
it must be from heat
apoplexy, he was on
Diary No. 40
board of us with Mr. Johnston
just before we left Basreh
and was alright; some
people called; I took a cold
both & feel better on it,
at 4 P.M. called on Shekoory
Sayegh & his family, also
on Yacoob Eassayi &
on Sister Aliza; came home
found Sister Emilia Alice
and Grzesiki~
The wind blew very hot
today, the Thermotre. went up
to 110° but the evening got
cool & pleasant;
Light N.W. & fine cool
morning~ at 7 Am. I
called on Menusha and
then came on board, I went
to the Mudeer & got my Tents
permitted to be discharged
in Goffa & sent home;
and gave him the Raftyeh
div2.head:
' 31 Tuesd
Diary No 40
which I had got at Balus
and paid the duty about
125 G. S. P. ~ The Mejidieh
is discharging wool alongside
& the Mossul went out;
at 9 I went on shore to my house
Got the Tents & opened them
I find the rather inferior
quality, but at all events they
are cheap;~
div2.p:
The SS. Baghdad arrived at 9 1/2
AM ~ at 4 P.M. I called on
Sister Medula & came home,
Johny called in the evening
Light N.W. & fine weather
Light N. W. breeze & fine,
at 7 am called on Mons.
Achille, found him the same
as before, I called on Antone
Marine, also went to see
Jeboory Asfar's wife she came
in this morning from the garden
to her her likeness & her children's
also taken in Photography
div2.head: 1894 July

' Augst 1st Wedn
Diary No 40
Antone & I then came home
to show him my Tents, at
9 1/2 I came on board, the
Mejidieh is out & the Mossul
is loading to leave tomorrow,
at 10 I went to the office
for some money; came home
at 11~ at 4 P.M. sent the big
Tent the Swiss cottage to Henry's
house to be pitched there and
to see it, Eliza Tookyeh Alexander
also Antone Marine and others
came, I found it very good
and large enough it is 14
by 12 feet the inside room
only besides the Bath room
and verandah all around;
We came home at 6~

' 2d Thursd
Diary No 40
their wages for July, Rupee
at 24 & Mejidy @ at 75 they
latter goes for 77 P. in the bazaar,
div2.p:
At 11 went home, had a cold
water Bath; ~ weather not so
hot as there is some wind from
the N.W.~ since last trip my
pain in the stomach is gone
& am still using the tonic
powder that Dr. Sunderg had
given me ~ It is strickmine~

At 4 P.M. called on Sister Eliza
and then came home~

Light N.W. & fine weather
Light N.W. & fine weather,
at 4 AM called on sister Eliza
& then took Artin & called
on Elias Serkis & then came
on board; we are Shipping
wool & other cargo, also
discharging; at 11 went
home, at 3 P.M. returned
on board gave Bills of Lading
& shipping receipts for through
cargo etc~
div2.head:
1894 Augst 3 Frid
At 5 went home, Weather
calm & air from N. Est all
the night;
div2.p:
Light N. Ely & fine; at 7 am
passed to sister Eliza & took
Artin & called on Eliza Erame
& at 8 1/2 came on board,
at 9 went on shore; went
to the office to look for the Shortage
of the money still amounts to
about 1200 G. S. P.; came home
had a cold water Bath ~

At 4 P.M. Eliza, Tookyeh & I
went to Alice & sister Emilia
I then took Artin my nephew
& went to call on Rustum
Effendi the Mudir of Amara
Custum House who came
with us this time to condole
him on the death of his father
Sheikh Abdulrezack son of
Sheikh Kader, we returned
to Clements house & took
Eliza Tookyeh & Alexander
& came home, Johny &
Artin came with us &
div2.head: ' Satur 4

Sund 5th
spent the eveing ~
Light S. Westerly, but got
cooler later on & goot Cool
during the night & moon
2 days old;
div2.p:
Light N.W. & fine cool morning
at 7 am. I came on board,
we are getting a lot of passengers,
at 11 went to breakfast & returned
at 1 P.M; we shipped cargo &
I gave tickets to about 200 passengers,
It got very warm & calm in
the afternoon ~ at 6 1/4 P.M.
I left the ship ~ Weather
got cooler at night ~

At about 12 P.M. the S.S.
Khalifah arrived ~

Light N.W & fine weather
at 3 1/2 am I came on
board ~ Ship is light
rowing about 115,000 Okes
cargo ~
div2.head: 1894 Augst
[-13: A conflict about the sikness of the deceased Perry]
[Dawerzika]
[-25: Kaimakam el-Haj Taleb Effendi]
1894 Augst.
6 Mond Ther @ 5. 82 Noon 94 4 P.M. 102
